member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Errors have been discovered on your Hard Disk. In order to fix these errors, Windows needs to restart to enter a special error fixing mode. This may take a long time to complete. Select Yes to fix the problem, No to continue with the migration without fixing, or Cancel to exit the application.

member.name: T:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash
member.summary: Hash functions are fundamental to modern cryptography. These functions map binary strings of an arbitrary length to small binary strings of a fixed length, known as hash values. A cryptographic hash function has the property that it is computationally infeasible to find two distinct inputs that hash to the same value. Hash functions are commonly used with digital signatures and for data integrity.

member.name: T:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.Provider
member.summary: Type of hash; some are security oriented, others are fast and simple

member.name: F:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.Provider.CRC32
member.summary: Cyclic Redundancy Check provider, 32-bit

member.name: F:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.Provider.SHA1
member.summary: Secure Hashing Algorithm provider, SHA-1 variant, 160-bit

member.name: F:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.Provider.SHA256
member.summary: Secure Hashing Algorithm provider, SHA-2 variant, 256-bit

member.name: F:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.Provider.SHA384
member.summary: Secure Hashing Algorithm provider, SHA-2 variant, 384-bit

member.name: F:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.Provider.SHA512
member.summary: Secure Hashing Algorithm provider, SHA-2 variant, 512-bit

member.name: F:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.Provider.MD5
member.summary: Message Digest algorithm 5, 128-bit

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.#ctor(MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.Provider)
member.summary: Instantiate a new hash of the specified type

member.name: P:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.Value
member.summary: Returns the previously calculated hash

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.Calculate(System.IO.Stream@)
member.summary: Calculates hash on a stream of arbitrary length

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.Calculate(MigAssistant.Encryption.Data)
member.summary: Calculates hash for fixed length

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.Calculate(MigAssistant.Encryption.Data,MigAssistant.Encryption.Data)
member.summary: Calculates hash for a string with a prefixed salt value. A "salt" is random data prefixed to every hashed value to prevent common dictionary attacks.

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Hash.CalculatePrivate(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Calculates hash for an array of bytes

member.name: T:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric
member.summary: Symmetric encryption uses a single key to encrypt and decrypt. Both parties (encryptor and decryptor) must share the same secret key.

member.name: F:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Provider.DES
member.summary: The Data Encryption Standard provider supports a 64 bit key only

member.name: F:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Provider.RC2
member.summary: The Rivest Cipher 2 provider supports keys ranging from 40 to 128 bits, default is 128 bits

member.name: F:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Provider.Rijndael
member.summary: The Rijndael (also known as AES) provider supports keys of 128, 192, or 256 bits with a default of 256 bits

member.name: F:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Provider.TripleDES
member.summary: The TripleDES provider (also known as 3DES) supports keys of 128 or 192 bits with a default of 192 bits

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.#ctor(MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Provider,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Instantiates a new symmetric encryption object using the specified provider.

member.name: P:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.KeySizeBytes
member.summary: Key size in bytes. We use the default key size for any given provider; if you want to force a specific key size, set this property

member.name: P:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.KeySizeBits
member.summary: Key size in bits. We use the default key size for any given provider; if you want to force a specific key size, set this property

member.name: P:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Key
member.summary: The key used to encrypt/decrypt data

member.name: P:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.IntializationVector
member.summary: Using the default Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) mode, all data blocks are processed using the value derived from the previous block; the first data block has no previous data block to use, so it needs an InitializationVector to feed the first block

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.RandomInitializationVector
member.summary: generates a random Initialization Vector, if one was not provided

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.RandomKey
member.summary: generates a random Key, if one was not provided

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.ValidateKeyAndIv(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Ensures that _crypto object has valid Key and IV prior to any attempt to encrypt/decrypt anything

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Encrypt(MigAssistant.Encryption.Data,MigAssistant.Encryption.Data)
member.summary: Encrypts the specified Data using provided key

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Encrypt(MigAssistant.Encryption.Data)
member.summary: Encrypts the specified Data using preset key and preset initialization vector

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Encrypt(System.IO.Stream,MigAssistant.Encryption.Data,MigAssistant.Encryption.Data)
member.summary: Encrypts the stream to memory using provided key and provided initialization vector

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Encrypt(System.IO.Stream,MigAssistant.Encryption.Data)
member.summary: Encrypts the stream to memory using specified key

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Encrypt(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Encrypts the specified stream to memory using preset key and preset initialization vector

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Decrypt(MigAssistant.Encryption.Data,MigAssistant.Encryption.Data)
member.summary: Decrypts the specified data using provided key and preset initialization vector

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Decrypt(System.IO.Stream,MigAssistant.Encryption.Data)
member.summary: Decrypts the specified stream using provided key and preset initialization vector

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Decrypt(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Decrypts the specified stream using preset key and preset initialization vector

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Symmetric.Decrypt(MigAssistant.Encryption.Data)
member.summary: Decrypts the specified data using preset key and preset initialization vector

member.name: T:MigAssistant.Encryption.Asymmetric
member.summary: Asymmetric encryption uses a pair of keys to encrypt and decrypt. There is a "public" key which is used to encrypt. Decrypting, on the other hand, requires both the "public" key and an additional "private" key. The advantage is that people can send you encrypted messages without being able to decrypt them.
member.remarks: The only provider supported is the

member.name: T:MigAssistant.Encryption.Asymmetric.PublicKey
member.summary: Represents a public encryption key. Intended to be shared, it contains only the Modulus and Exponent.

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Asymmetric.PublicKey.LoadFromConfig
member.summary: Load public key from App.config or Web.config file

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Asymmetric.PublicKey.ToConfigSection
member.summary: Returns *.config file XML section representing this public key

member.summary: Writes the *.config file representation of this public key to a file

member.summary: Loads the public key from its XML string

member.summary: Converts this public key to an RSAParameters object

member.summary: Converts this public key to its XML string representation

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Asymmetric.PublicKey.ExportToXmlFile(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the Xml representation of this public key to a file

member.name: T:MigAssistant.Encryption.Asymmetric.PrivateKey
member.summary: Represents a private encryption key. Not intended to be shared, as it contains all the elements that make up the key.

member.summary: Converts this private key to its XML string representation

member.summary: Writes the Xml representation of this private key to a file

member.name: T:MigAssistant.Encryption.Data
member.summary: represents Hex, Byte, Base64, or String data to encrypt/decrypt; use the .Text property to set/get a string representation use the .Hex property to set/get a string-based Hexadecimal representation use the .Base64 to set/get a string-based Base64 representation

member.name: F:MigAssistant.Encryption.Data.DefaultEncoding
member.summary: Determines the default text encoding across ALL Data instances

member.name: F:MigAssistant.Encryption.Data.Encoding
member.summary: Determines the default text encoding for this Data instance

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Data.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new, empty encryption data

member.summary: Creates new encryption data with the specified byte array

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Data.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates new encryption data with the specified string; will be converted to byte array using default encoding

member.name: M:MigAssistant.Encryption.Data.#ctor(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Creates new encryption data using the specified string and the specified encoding to convert the string to a byte array.

member.name: P:MigAssistant.Encryption.Data.IsEmpty
member.summary: returns true if no data is present

member.summary: allowed step interval, in bytes, for this data; if 0, no limit

member.name: P:MigAssistant.Encryption.Data.StepBits
member.summary: allowed step interval, in bits, for this data; if 0, no limit

member.summary: minimum number of bytes allowed for this data; if 0, no limit

member.summary: minimum number of bits allowed for this data; if 0, no limit

member.name: P:MigAssistant.Encryption.Data.MaxBytes
member.summary: maximum number of bytes allowed for this data; if 0, no limit

member.name: P:MigAssistant.Encryption.Data.MaxBits
member.summary: maximum number of bits allowed for this data; if 0, no limit

member.name: P:MigAssistant.Encryption.Data.Bytes
member.summary: Returns the byte representation of the data; This will be padded to MinBytes and trimmed to MaxBytes as necessary!

member.summary: Sets or returns text representation of bytes using the default text encoding

member.summary: Sets or returns Hex string representation of this data

member.summary: Sets or returns Base64 string representation of this data
